intro: Gymnosporia senegalensis subsp. senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese gymnosporia, is a shrub native to the savannas of West Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Gymnosporia senegalensis subsp. senegalensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
